info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 11:42PM EDT until August 1 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey, including the following county, Cumberland.
* WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1140 PM EDT, Runoff from recent heavy rainfall has resulted in rises along area rovers and streams. The Cohansey River at Seeley has risen above flood stage. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cohansey River COHANSEY-MAURICE, Parsonage Run COHANSEY- MAURICE, Barrett Run COHANSEY-MAURICE and Cornwell Run COHANSEY-MAURICE. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Bridgeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT FRIDAY
